page.title: 13SUBMARINE "RESURGAM," RHYL
page.content: The "Resurgam" submarine was built in Birkenhead in 1879. It sank just off the Foryd harbour, Rhyl, in 1881. It was the first ever mechanical submarine to be built. Recently naval divers have been carrying out tests on the submarine and have sent down echo sounder traces and the measurements seem to be the same as the "Resurgam." Commander R. Compton-Hall said, "She will be in very bad condition when she is raised." She will be restored in Gosport. The shipbuilders charged Â£1,600 + Â£50 launching fee. This summer the local newspapers have carried accounts of the plans to try and raise this submarine.
